info.author: Momar Hughes
info.description:
=================
ORCycle README
=================

.. contents::

About
=========

:Version:
   0.1
:Author:
   Momar Hughes
:Contact:
   momar.hughes@unsw.edu.au
:Topic:
   Thermodynamic heat cycle sizing and analysis
:Licence:
   MIT
:Requires:
   numpy, scipy, matplotlib, CoolProp


ORCycle is a Python3 module for 1-dimensional analysis and sizing of thermodynamic heat cycles, particularly the organic Rankine cycle. Sizing methods are based on empirical and theoretical correlations. Users may analyse cycles consisting of components including heaters, coolers, compressors, expanders and heat exchangers. The two main modes for analysing cycles or components are:

* *solve* : calculates a component characteristic/dimension required to satisfy a desired component outlet flow state/cycle flow states. This mode is used for sizing components.

* *run* : calculates working fluid cycle flow states/ component outlet flow state based on user-defined characteristics/dimensions of the components.

The Github project page can be found at `http://github.com/momargoh/ORCycle <http://github.com/momargoh/ORCycle>`_. The documentation is hosted at `https://orcycle.readthedocs.io <http://orcycle.readthedocs.io/en/latest>`_


Installation
============
For the latest updates, clone/download the source code from the `Github page <https://github.com/momargoh/ORCycle>`_ and run::

  python3 setup.py install

For the latest stable release, ORCycle is available from pip by running:: 

  sudo pip3 install orcycle

ORCycle requires `CoolProp  <http://www.coolprop.org>`_, a free and open-source thermodynamic properties library. It is recommended to manually install the latest version of CoolProp before installing ORCycle (rather than installing from pip which is not the latest version). Refer to their `guide on manual installation <http://www.coolprop.org/coolprop/wrappers/Python/index.html#manual-installation>`_ and have a look the author's :ref:`notes on installing CoolProp <installing_CoolProp>`.

ORCycle is available under the MIT licence, hence free for everybody to use and edit. 

Contributions towards the project source code will be gratefully received. Feel free to contact the author via email or GitHub with any queries.

Quick start
===========
Have a look through ``orcycle/examples`` to get a feel for how to use the module (`link to documentaion <http://orcycle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples/examples.html>`_). These examples can be easily copied to your local directory and modified to get you started.

.. _installing_CoolProp:

Notes on installing CoolProp from source for Python3
=====================================================

I have installed CoolProp numerous times on different computers and have come across many problems with the build. So I decided to create this section to step through the process of installing CoolProp from the `Github source code <https://github.com/CoolProp/CoolProp.git>`_ for use with Python3. This is the process I took using Python3.6 on Ubuntu 17.10. Although CoolProp can be installed using pip3, I have had problems with the latest stable release, hence why I recommend installing from source.

Requirements::

  sudo apt install build-essential python3 python3-dev python3-pip python3-tk cython3 git
  pip3 install numpy
  pip3 install scipy
  pip3 install matplotlib

Now clone CoolProp to a folder of your choice::

  cd PATH/TO/CLONE/FOLDER
  git clone https://github.com/CoolProp/CoolProp.git --recursive

Now install the Python wrapper::

  cd wrappers/Python
  sudo python3 setup.py install

At this point, CoolProp should be installed and ready to use!

Once, the installation failed because /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages did not exist, thus I ran::

  sudo mkdir -p /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages

Another time, I had to rename the original cloned CoolProp folder to stop Python3 finding it when importing::

  sudo mv PATH/TO/CLONE/FOLDER/CoolProp PATH/TO/CLONE/FOLDER/CoolProp_MASTER
info.keywords: thermodynamics organic Rankine cycle heat cycle power cycle evaporator expander condenser compressor heat-exchanger heater cooler
info.name: orcycle
